extendedIngredients.name: chestnuts
extendedIngredients.original: 1 cup peeled cooked whole chestnuts (from a 7- to 8-oince jar), cut into thirds
extendedIngredients.originalName: peeled cooked whole chestnuts (from a 7- to 8-oince jar), cut into thirds

extendedIngredients.name: chicory
extendedIngredients.original: 3/4 pound chicory (curly endive), trimmed and torn into 2-inch pieces (10 cups)
extendedIngredients.originalName: 3/4 pound chicory (curly endive), trimmed and torn into 2-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: olive oil
extendedIngredients.original: 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil plus additional for greasing
extendedIngredients.originalName: extra-virgin olive oil plus additional for greasing

extendedIngredients.name: pancetta
extendedIngredients.original: 4 (1/4-inch-thick) slices pancetta (6 ounce total), cut into 1/4-inch dice
extendedIngredients.originalName: thick) slices pancetta (6 ounce total), cut into 1/4-inch dice

title: Roasted Squash, Chestnut, and Chicory Salad with Cranberry Vinaigrette
summary: Roasted Squash, Chestnut, and Chicory Salad with Cranberry Vinaigrette might be just the side dish you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains roughly 3g of protein, 6g of fat, and a total of 178 calories. This recipe serves 6 and costs $1.1 per serving. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. A mixture of acorn squash, pancetta, chestnuts, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, and fodmap friendly diet. With a spoonacular score of 83%, this dish is outstanding. Try Chicory Salad with Maple-Roasted Acorn Squash, Kale Salad with Brie Croutons, Roasted Butternut Squash, Cumin-Spiced Pecans and a Cranberry Vinaigrette, and Roasted Winter Squash, Cranberry, and Almond Salad with Lemon Dijon Balsamic Vinaigrette (vegan, gluten-free, soy-free) for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 450°F. Line a large shallow baking pan with foil and oil generously with olive oil.                                                                Cut off stem end of squash, then put cut side down and halve lengthwise. Discard seeds, then cut squash into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Peel if desired with a paring knife and transfer slices to a bowl. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper and gently toss to coat. Arrange in 1 layer in lined baking pan and roast until golden, about 15 minutes. Remove from oven and turn squash over with a spatula. Add chestnuts to pan in an even layer, then continue to roast until squash is golden and tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Keep warm, covered with foil.                                                                While squash is roasting, cook pancetta in a dry 10-inch heavy skillet over high heat until browned, about 4 minutes total. Transfer pancetta with a slotted spoon to paper towels to drain, reserving fat in skillet.                                                                Reheat pancetta fat over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then add cranberries and brown sugar and stir once to combine. Remove from heat and add water, stirring and scraping up brown bits from bottom of skillet.                                                                Transfer cranberry mixture to a medium bowl and whisk in mustard, remaining tablespoon olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.                                                                Toss together chicory, roasted acorn squash, and chestnuts. Just before serving, toss with dressing and sprinkle with pancetta.

steps.step: Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 450°F. Line a large shallow baking pan with foil and oil generously with olive oil.
Cut off stem end of squash, then put cut side down and halve lengthwise. Discard seeds, then cut squash into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Peel if desired with a paring knife and transfer slices to a bowl.
Add 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper and gently toss to coat. Arrange in 1 layer in lined baking pan and roast until golden, about 15 minutes.
Remove from oven and turn squash over with a spatula.
Add chestnuts to pan in an even layer, then continue to roast until squash is golden and tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Keep warm, covered with foil.
While squash is roasting, cook pancetta in a dry 10-inch heavy skillet over high heat until browned, about 4 minutes total.
Transfer pancetta with a slotted spoon to paper towels to drain, reserving fat in skillet.
Reheat pancetta fat over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then add cranberries and brown sugar and stir once to combine.
Remove from heat and add water, stirring and scraping up brown bits from bottom of skillet.
Transfer cranberry mixture to a medium bowl and whisk in mustard, remaining tablespoon olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Toss together chicory, roasted acorn squash, and chestnuts. Just before serving, toss with dressing and sprinkle with pancetta.
